snippet: The ferry, licensed to carry a maximum of 85 passengers, was carrying about 200 when it was caught in bad weather and then sank while crossing a river.
abstract: Ferry overloaded with more than 200 passengers is hit by high waves, capsizes and sinks while crossing a river in central Bangladesh; despite rescue efforts by naval forces and fire brigades, at least half the passengers are missing and presumed dead.

byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and HARI KUMAR
byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: The ferry, licensed to carry a maximum of 85 passengers, was carrying about 200 when it was caught in bad weather and then sank while crossing a river.

headline.main: 100 Missing in Bangladesh as High Waves Capsize Ferry
headline.print_headline: 100 Missing in Bangladesh as High Waves Capsize Ferry
